channel.title: News : NPR
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2023 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Scientists say a new epoch marked by human impact—the Anthropocene—began in 1950s
item.description: The Anthropocene Working Group is proposing a small but deep lake outside of Toronto, Canada — Crawford Lake — to place a historic marker.
item.content:encoded:
The Anthropocene Working Group is proposing a small but deep lake outside of Toronto, Canada — Crawford Lake — to place a historic marker.

(Image credit: Cole Burston/The Canadian Press via AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: DOJ won't shield Trump from claims he defamed writer E. Jean Carroll
item.description: The move reverses course on one of the Justice Department's most controversial decisions during the early stretch of the Biden administration.
item.content:encoded:
The move reverses course on one of the Justice Department's most controversial decisions during the early stretch of the Biden administration.

(Image credit: Matt Rourke/AP)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: Bank of America to pay $250 million for illegal fees, fake accounts
item.description: An investigation found that Bank of America raked in tens of millions of dollars in resubmitted insufficient funds fees. The bank also illegally opened credit cards without customers knowledge.
item.content:encoded:
An investigation found that Bank of America raked in tens of millions of dollars in resubmitted insufficient funds fees. The bank also illegally opened credit cards without customers knowledge.

(Image credit: Jeff Chiu/AP)
item.dc:creator: Dustin Jones

item.title: 'Fresh Air' hosts Terry Gross and Tonya Mosley talk news, Detroit and psychedelics
item.description: Throughout her career, Mosley has often been one of the few Black journalists in the newsroom. She recently reported first-hand on the use of psilocybin to heal racial trauma.
item.content:encoded:
Throughout her career, Mosley has often been one of the few Black journalists in the newsroom. She recently reported first-hand on the use of psilocybin to heal racial trauma.

(Image credit: Tonya Mosley)
item.dc:creator: Terry Gross

item.title: Heavy rains produce major floods in Vermont, New York and other parts of the Northeast
item.description: The National Weather Service said heavy rains across New England would subside Tuesday, but officials warned that flooding still presented a danger to residents.
item.content:encoded:
The National Weather Service said heavy rains across New England would subside Tuesday, but officials warned that flooding still presented a danger to residents.

(Image credit: John Minchillo/AP)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: In Sudan's Darfur, a rights group calls for an investigation into mounting atrocities
item.description: Human Rights Watch is calling for the International Criminal Court to investigate attacks the rights group says amount to war crimes in West Darfur.
item.content:encoded:
Human Rights Watch is calling for the International Criminal Court to investigate attacks the rights group says amount to war crimes in West Darfur.

(Image credit: AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Akinwotu

item.title: One senator's abortion protest leaves the Marine Corps without a permanent leader
item.description: The Marine Corps' highest-ranking officer position fell vacant on Monday thanks to a move from Sen. Tommy Tuberville, R-Ala., who continues to block nominations to protest a Pentagon abortion policy.
item.content:encoded:
The Marine Corps' highest-ranking officer position fell vacant on Monday thanks to a move from Sen. Tommy Tuberville, R-Ala., who continues to block nominations to protest a Pentagon abortion policy.

(Image credit: Drew Angerer/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Emily Olson

item.title: Justice Sotomayor's staff urged schools and libraries to buy her memoir or kid's books
item.description: The works have earned Sotomayor $3.7 million since she joined the court in 2009. Her taxpayer-funded staffers have been deeply involved in organizing speaking engagements intended to sell the books.
item.content:encoded:
The works have earned Sotomayor $3.7 million since she joined the court in 2009. Her taxpayer-funded staffers have been deeply involved in organizing speaking engagements intended to sell the books.

(Image credit: John Amis/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Northwestern football coach Pat Fitzgerald is fired following hazing investigation
item.description: An investigation was launched in December 2022 after Northwestern University received an anonymous complaint about hazing activities in the school's football program.
item.content:encoded:
An investigation was launched in December 2022 after Northwestern University received an anonymous complaint about hazing activities in the school's football program.

(Image credit: Carlos Osorio/AP)
item.dc:creator: Dustin Jones

item.title: 'When Crack Was King' follows four people who lived through the drug epidemic
item.description: An excellent work of people-first journalism, Donovan X. Ramsey's book offers a vivid and frank history and highlights how communities tend to save themselves even as they're being targeted.
item.content:encoded:
An excellent work of people-first journalism, Donovan X. Ramsey's book offers a vivid and frank history and highlights how communities tend to save themselves even as they're being targeted.

(Image credit: One World)
item.dc:creator: Ilana Masad

item.title: Deaths from xylazine are on the rise. The White House has a new plan to tackle it
item.description: Deaths from overdoses of Xylazine-laced fentanyl have surged. The White House drug czar says he's marshalling efforts on testing, tracking, treatment, and stopping the spread.
item.content:encoded:
Deaths from overdoses of Xylazine-laced fentanyl have surged. The White House drug czar says he's marshalling efforts on testing, tracking, treatment, and stopping the spread.

(Image credit: Angela Weiss/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Deepa Shivaram

item.title: Up First briefing: Sweden's NATO approval; Israel protests; Emmy predictions
item.description: Turkey agreed to allow Sweden to join NATO. Protests resume in Israel over a planned judicial overhaul. It's a weird year for the Emmys. Here are the NPR culture desk's predictions.
item.content:encoded:
Turkey agreed to allow Sweden to join NATO. Protests resume in Israel over a planned judicial overhaul. It's a weird year for the Emmys. Here are the NPR culture desk's predictions.

(Image credit: Yves Herman/POOL/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen

item.title: New malaria vaccine offers a ray of hope to Nigeria. There's just one thing ...
item.description: The country's toll makes up nearly a third of the world's 619,000 malaria deaths each year. Now Nigeria has approved a new vaccine. Will it get into the arms of those who need it most?
item.content:encoded:
The country's toll makes up nearly a third of the world's 619,000 malaria deaths each year. Now Nigeria has approved a new vaccine. Will it get into the arms of those who need it most?

(Image credit: Emma Houston/Xinhua via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Tolani Yesufu

item.title: Trump asks the judge to delay the start of his classified documents trial
item.description: The former president foreshadowed some of the legal challenges he will mount against the unprecedented federal criminal case against him.
item.content:encoded:
The former president foreshadowed some of the legal challenges he will mount against the unprecedented federal criminal case against him.

(Image credit: Drew Angerer/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: An old drug offers a new way to stop STIs
item.description: Taken after sex, the antibiotic doxycycline can ward off some sexually transmitted illnesses. Doctors are already prescribing it and the CDC is expected to share guidance soon for how best to use it.
item.content:encoded:
Taken after sex, the antibiotic doxycycline can ward off some sexually transmitted illnesses. Doctors are already prescribing it and the CDC is expected to share guidance soon for how best to use it.

(Image credit: MirageC/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Will Stone
